How to Exercise Your Eyes 
	 - Strengthen your eyes’ near and far focusing. 
	 - Practice zooming with your eyes. 
	 - Make a figure eight with your eyes. 
	 - Practice rhythmic eye movements. 
	 - Do directional eye exercises. 
	 - End your exercises with palming.

Stiff Neck Exercises 
	 Consult your doctor if you have chronic pain 
	 or suffered an injury. 
		 - Turn your head slowly to the left and right. 
		 - Do a set of side bend neck stretches. 
		 - Do 5 to 10 diagonal neck stretches per side. 
		 - Shrug and rotate your shoulders 10 times. 
		 - Lift your head while lying on your back. 
		 - Do 5 to 10 head lifts while lying on your side.

Exercises for Jaw Tension 
	TMJ Jaw Stretch. 
		 The TMJ jaw stretch can help loosen and relax tight 
		 jaw muscles. 
	Jaw Resistance Exercise. 
		 The jaw resistance exercise helps to gently stretch… 
	Side-to-Side Jaw Stretch. 
		 This exercise stretches the sides of your 
		 jaw and relaxes… 
	The Smile Stretch. 
		 The smile stretch helps alleviate jaw tension…

Shoulder Stretches and Exercises 
	Exercise #1 
		 Stand perpendicular to the door with your feet about 
		 shoulder-width apart. Hold the band in the hand of 
		 the shoulder you wishto exercise and bend your elbow 
		 90 degrees. Keep your elbow tucked into the side of 
		 your body with your hand over your navel, and then 
		 slowly rotate your shoulder outwards. 
	Exercise #2 
		 This is a simple strengthening move that can be done 
		 pretty much anywhere.Stand up tall and straight. 
		 Slowly flex your shoulder blades back and together. 
		 Imagine suspending a pencil in between your shoulder 
		 blades.

5 Stretches to Ease Your Lower Back Pain 
	Child’s Pose. 
		 This common yoga posture gently stretches the 
		 muscles of the low back,… 
	Cat/Cow Stretch. 
		 This dynamic movement moves the low back 
		 musicles in two directions,… 
	Lower-Back Twist. 
		 This movement not only helps to stretch your 
		 lower back but also your glutes,… 
	Knee-to-Chest Stretch. 
		 Similar…

Pigeon stretch. 
	 Place your right ankle in front of your left hip. 
	 Straighten your left leg behind you, making sure 
	 your left knee is straight and your toes are pointed. 
	 Keep your hips square. Gently lower yourself to 
	 the ground. 
	 Stay in this position for up to 10 seconds. 
	 Release the position by pushing on your hands, 
	 lifting your hips,…
